emuInput.TitMainTitle: Reverend Harold Tolliver reading from book on lectern in Grace Memorial Presbyterian Church
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 25, 1949, pg. 11 reads: "Elect Rev. H.R. Tolliver Moderator of Presbytery - Plan Testimonial For Grace Pastor At Church June 30 - Portion of accompanying article reads: "One of the highest honors in Presbyterian Church was bestowed upon the Rev. Harold R. Tolliver, pastor at Grace Memorial Presbyterian Church, Tuesday when he was elected Moderator of the Presbytery of Pittsburgh.  He is the third Negro minister to head this second largest Presbytery in the Presbyterian Church, USA, and the first one in thirty years - Dr. M.B. Lanier, holding the honor first, and Dr. Charles H. Trusty being the second Negro chosen.  June 30, at 7:30 P.M., the officers, members and friends of Grace Memorial will honor the Rev. Mr. Tolliver with a testimonial banquet at the church, in appreciation of his eighteen years of ecclesiastical service at Grace."
